data.title: Problem with syntax highlighting and autocomplete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|;

---
![renderproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16859342/25070460/18a74d28-22c9-11e7-9389-b0ab712f3d8b.jpg)

`singletonInstanceOperation` was rendered with wrong color.

![autocompleteproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16859342/25070486/f750dc60-22c9-11e7-969a-1a5cb66b4943.jpg)

The autocomplete for `IOperationSingletonInstance` is not what it supposed to be. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type the code in `Controllers/OperationsController.cs` to VSCode: [https://github.com/aspnet/Docs/tree/master/aspnetcore/fundamentals/dependency-injection/sample](url)
2. `singletonInstanceOperation` is green instead of white. 
3. When  we type `private readonly IOperationSingletonInstance`, the autocomplete appeared but the character is not appeared with right color.

2. `cd badges`

What I want:

For this to not be the case, as I use [projectz](https://github.com/bevry/projectz) on my projectz, which uses [badges](https://github.com/bevry/badges) for the `badges` property.

data.title: Is it possible to build editor separately?
data.body:
I know that Monaco-editor exists, but it's "too complete" for my test.
Is it possible to extract just editor (editing window with minimap, and all annotation, suggestion services associated) and build it for another project?

Thanks in advance

data.title: Editor Link With Escaped Hashtag Not Opening Properly
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12 insiders

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Create new text document with the content: `https://twitter.com/search?src=typd&q=%23tag`
2. Cmd click on the link

**Expected**
Opens the page: https://twitter.com/search?src=typd&q=%23tag

**Actual**
Opens the page: https://twitter.com/search?src=typd&q=#tag

data.title: word color
data.body:
Hi, recently I started to work on c++ project using vscode. My problem is that when I type some major words (for example vector'<'string'>', neither vector nor string are colored ), the editor does not color it.
Could you please add a method to color some selected words and specify the color?

data.title: API: Provide an onMoved event for when the user moves a file/folder in the explorer
data.body:
I created an [extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=stringham.move-ts) which updates relative imports when you move a typescript file or a folder. Unfortunately, it's kind of clunky because it only works when the user uses the explorer context menu or the command pallet to move the items.

It would be great if I could hook into an event which occurs when the user moves a file or folder in the explorer. The FileSystemWatcher API currently has hooks for creation, deletion, and modification.

It would be possible to detect a file move with the onCreate and onDelete methods, but those events happen even when the creation/deletion originate from outside of vscode.

data.title: Inconsistent intellisense behaviors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (9530cf6e2b804c4b986d97f105f88d40ee4d2c47, 2017-04-14T11:59:40.760Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16176
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-class-suggestions|AndersEAndersen|1.0.4|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|reg|ionutvmi|0.0.1|
|latex-workshop|James-Yu|1.4.2|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.3|
|java|redhat|0.1.0|
|vscode-open|sandcastle|0.1.0|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.2|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|markdown-all-in-one|yzhang|0.5.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. type some text (in .txt or other file with intellisense)
2. if the completionItem is not same with what I have typed, press <kbd>Enter</kbd> will insert the completionItem text. There is no problem and it's what we expect.
3. but if the completionItem is same with the text, press <kbd>Enter</kbd> will insert a new line.

![completion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7588612/25068611/affc2208-229b-11e7-8a91-0145b33722d8.gif)

I wonder if it's a new feature in recent versions. But in most cases, I don't want the new line.

data.title: clicked/hovered problems always display in a dark theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. use a light theme
2. have a project with problems
3. open the problems view
4. click or hover the mouse over a problem

it seems like clicked and hovered problems use colors from a dark theme which obviously doesn't work well with light themes

i took this screenshot: https://files.catbox.moe/lmtb4w.png (not my code! the first problem is clicked, the third one is hovered)

i use the "default light" theme but it seems to occur with all light themes (you won't notice the bug if you use a dark theme)

i found some stuff that might be related:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=+tree&type=Commits

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23506

data.title: Could not see tasks in "Run tasks" list.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. tasks file:
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "echo",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [],
    "showOutput": "always",
    "echoCommand": true,
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "hello",
            "args": ["Hello World"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "bye",
            "args": ["Good Bye"]
        }
    ]
}
2. Cmd + Shift + P
3. Select "Tasks: Run Task"
I was expecting "hello" and "bye" to be available options. They do not come up.
This should work as per VSCode doc
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_command-and-tasks

data.title: Let extension contribution commands also accept ICommandHandlerDescription
Here-Sring interrupts collapsing of functions
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a function with a here-string inside of it
2. Collapse the function

![vscode here-string issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27244659/25066392/1967b4c8-21f2-11e7-85ba-6533a2d5d3ac.png)

The expected behavior is to collapse the function at the opening brace and the closing brace. The function stops collapsing at the first sign of a here-string.

data.title: Feature request: Add Markdown headings to the symbols list
data.body:
One of the neat features of SublimeText is having all the Markdown headings in the symbols list allowing the user to navigate through them quickly.
Here is how it looks like in SublimeText:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10835824/25066222/9cf754dc-2220-11e7-89ac-fb9754cc5823.png)

It would be nice to see this feature in VS Code.

data.title: Debugging with mono and building with xbuild breaks debugging!
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Debian 8 jessie 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use mono in launch.json and xbuild for building
2. Try to debug program: Code execution pauses at breakpoint but i cant see variables, watch them or even see where the code is currently paused at.

launch.json:
```js
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "mono",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/SteamBot/bin/Debug/SteamBot.exe",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/SteamBot/bin/Debug/",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "env": {}
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "mono",
            "request": "attach",
            "address": "localhost",
            "port": 55555
        }
    ]
}
```

tasks.json:
```js
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "xbuild",
    "args": [
        "/property:GenerateFullPaths=true /debug:full /debug+"
    ],
    "taskSelector": "/t:",
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "build",
            "showOutput": "silent",
            "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: More font options

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: A lot of people use fonts like Fira Code, which doesn't has italics. Wouldn't that be great to have options to force no_italics, no_bold, etc?

data.title: Verified publisher
data.body:
Now this can be a little biased, but I was searching for Material Theme and found out that it's (kind of) original creator Mattia Astornio has its theme for VS Code too, it's just that it's install count is too low that it took me a while to find it. 

Wouldn't that be great if I get a Twitter/Instagram like tick mark to make sure that's a verified publisher and would continue to give updates or something. Thanks for even looking at this feature request too .

data.title: Cannot build vscode on recent releases
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go through the build instructions on Fedora, with all the dependencies installed
2. You will get this error/output
```
Building target platforms: x86_64
Building for target x86_64
Executing(%install): /bin/sh -e /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.pxWld8
+ umask 022
+ cd /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILD
+ '[' /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64 '!=' / ']'
+ rm -rf /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64
++ dirname /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64
+ mkdir -p /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT
+ mkdir /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64
+ mkdir -p /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64/usr/share/code-oss
+ mkdir -p /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64/usr/share/applications
+ mkdir -p /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64/usr/share/pixmaps
+ cp -r 'usr/share/code-oss/*' /home/bkeys/Devel/vscode-1.11.2/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/code-oss-1.11.2-1492271471.el7.x86_64/usr/share/code-oss
cp: cannot stat 'usr/share/code-oss/*': No such file or directory
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.pxWld8 (%install)
    Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.pxWld8 (%install)
RPM build errors:
[10:51:11] 'vscode-linux-x64-build-rpm' errored after 247 ms
[10:51:11] Error: Command `HOME="$(pwd)/.build/linux/rpm/x86_64" fakeroot rpmbuild -bb .build/linux/rpm/x86_64/rpmbuild/SPECS/code-oss.spec --target=x86_64` failed with exit code 1
    at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:206:12)
    at emitTwo (events.js:106:13)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:191:7)
    at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:877:16)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:226:5)
```
 
Perhaps it would be nice if you guys could provide a prebuilt .rpm/.deb files so that everyone wanting to use vscode specifically does not have to do this every release? Surely this can be done in an automated fashion.

data.title: Variable changing color when using accessor
data.body: One color is defined for "keyword.type.cs" (exemple : blue) One color is defined for "entity.name.variable.local.cs" (exemple : beige) One color is defined for "variable.other.object.cs" (exemple : green.) When i use a variable previously defined as "keyword.type.cs" or "entity.name.variable.local.cs" with the dot accessor ("punctuation.accessor.cs"), it is muted on "variable.other.object.cs" (and the color change, of course). For a code color coherence, we need to keep the color defined on the variable declaration. The variable must don't mute into "variable.other.object.cs" and keeps it color. - VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |html-class-suggestions|AndersEAndersen|1.0.7| |vscode-solarized|Braver|0.0.3| |crane|HvyIndustries|0.3.6| |csharpfixformat|Leopotam|0.0.20| |vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13| |code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.2| |html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0| |vscode-css-formatter|aeschli|0.0.2| |vscode-javascript-snippet-pack|akamud|0.1.5| |npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0| |path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0| |vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.1| |auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11| |vscode-jekyll-snippets|ginfuru|0.7.0| |csharpextensions|jchannon|1.3.0| |theme-gruvbox-dark-medium|jdinhlife|0.0.6| |language-asciidoc|justusadam|1.3.1| |docomment|k--kato|0.0.14| |markdown-shortcuts|mdickin|0.8.0| |vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.1| |csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1| |vscode-paste-image|mushan|0.3.0| |language-liquid|neilding|0.0.2| |view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.5| |java|redhat|0.1.0| |ClassyNaming|reflectiondm|1.0.0| |vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1| |visual-gruvbox-medium-dark|rphlmr|0.1.3| |aspnet-helper|schneiderpat|0.6.3| |theme-firewatch|ulthes|1.0.2|; --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2.

data.title: Cannot edit a temporary markdown file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: Fedora 25
Lets say I only wanted to write down a markdown file but not actually save it to a file. Right now I cannot preview that file as markdown until I save it as a .md file, which is not a big deal. But it would be nice to be able to preview it without saving the file. Perhaps a keyboard shortcut could be added to preview the current file as markdown?

data.title: Composition View is not shown in Windows 10 build 10.0.16176
data.body:
在编辑器中输入中文不会出现选择文字的横条。

是不能显示输入法，不是不能显示中文字符。

其他软件中正常，所以应该不是操作系统的原因。

（有朋友可以帮忙翻译成英文吗？我实在不知道“输入法”这个要怎样说，总不能是Google给的“Input method"吧，哈哈。多谢）

- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16176
